full_name: Markets in Financial Instruments Directive II (2014/65/EU)
description: EU legislation providing harmonized regulation for investment services across European Economic Area, enhancing investor protection and market transparency.

key_requirements.title: Client Categorization
key_requirements.description: Classify clients as retail, professional, or eligible counterparties
requirements: Categorize all clients upon onboarding
Apply appropriate protection levels based on classification
Allow clients to request different categorization
Maintain records of client classification decisions
Notify clients of their categorization

key_requirements.title: Best Execution
key_requirements.description: Take all sufficient steps to obtain best possible result for client orders
requirements: Establish and implement best execution policy
Consider price, costs, speed, likelihood of execution and settlement
Monitor effectiveness of execution arrangements regularly
Publish annual top five execution venues report
Obtain prior client consent to execution policy

key_requirements.title: Product Governance
key_requirements.description: Implement product governance arrangements for manufactured and distributed financial instruments
requirements: Define target market for each financial product
Conduct product approval process before distribution
Review products regularly and after significant events
Ensure products meet needs of identified target market
Provide distributors with relevant product information

key_requirements.title: Suitability and Appropriateness
key_requirements.description: Assess client knowledge, experience, and financial situation before providing services
requirements: Conduct suitability assessment for investment advice and portfolio management
Perform appropriateness test for complex products
Obtain information on client's investment objectives and risk tolerance
Provide suitability report to retail clients
Issue warnings when products are not appropriate

key_requirements.title: Transaction Reporting
key_requirements.description: Report details of transactions in financial instruments to competent authorities
requirements: Report all transactions in financial instruments to regulators
Submit reports by end of next working day (T+1)
Include required data fields per ESMA technical standards
Ensure accuracy and completeness of reported data
Implement systems to capture and transmit transaction reports

key_requirements.title: Market Transparency
key_requirements.description: Provide pre-trade and post-trade transparency for equity and non-equity instruments
requirements: Publish current bid and offer prices for traded instruments
Disclose post-trade information on executed transactions
Apply transparency requirements to equity and non-equity instruments
Implement transparency waivers only where permitted
Ensure real-time publication of trade data

key_requirements.title: Inducements and Conflicts of Interest
key_requirements.description: Manage and disclose conflicts of interest and restrictions on inducements
requirements: Identify and manage conflicts of interest
Disclose conflicts to clients before providing services
Prohibit inducements for independent investment advice
Ensure inducements enhance quality of service to client
Maintain conflicts of interest policy and register

key_requirements.title: Record Keeping
key_requirements.description: Maintain comprehensive records of services, transactions, and client communications
requirements: Record all services and transactions
Retain records for minimum 5 years
Record telephone conversations and electronic communications
Maintain client order records with timestamps
Ensure records are available for regulatory inspection

key_requirements.title: Algorithmic and High-Frequency Trading
key_requirements.description: Implement controls and risk management for algorithmic trading
requirements: Implement effective systems, risk controls, and governance
Test algorithms thoroughly before deployment
Monitor algorithmic trading systems in real-time
Implement kill switches and pre-trade controls
Notify regulators of algorithmic trading activity
Store accurate time-sequenced records of all orders

key_requirements.title: Client Asset Protection
key_requirements.description: Safeguard client assets and funds through segregation and oversight
requirements: Segregate client assets from firm's own assets
Hold client funds in designated client accounts
Conduct regular reconciliations of client positions
Implement organizational arrangements to minimize risk of loss
Provide client asset protection disclosures

compliance_checklist: Client categorization process implemented and documented
Best execution policy established and published
Product governance framework for manufactured products
Target market definition for all distributed products
Pre-trade and post-trade transparency requirements met
Conflicts of interest identified and managed
Inducements policy compliant with MiFID II restrictions
Telephone and electronic communications recording implemented
Algorithmic trading controls and testing procedures
Client assets segregated from firm assets
Client reporting and disclosures provided as required
